Docs.summary: SAX2 extension handler for DTD declaration events.

remarks.para:
SAX2 extension handler for DTD declaration events.
This module, both source code and documentation, is in the Public Domain, and comes with NO WARRANTY. See http://www.saxproject.org for further information.

This is an optional extension handler for SAX2 to provide more complete information about DTD declarations in an XML document. XML readers are not required to recognize this handler, and it is not part of core-only SAX2 distributions.
Note that data-related DTD declarations (unparsed entities and notations) are already reported through the org.xml.sax.DTDHandler DTDHandler interface.

If you are using the declaration handler together with a lexical handler, all of the events will occur between the org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler#startDTD startDTD and the org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler#endDTD endDTD events.

To set the DeclHandler for an XML reader, use the org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setProperty setProperty method with the property name http://xml.org/sax/properties/declaration-handler and an object implementing this interface (or null) as the value. If the reader does not report declaration events, it will throw a org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException SAXNotRecognizedException when you attempt to register the handler.
Added in SAX 2.0 (extensions 1.0).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub AttributeDecl (eName As String, aName As String, type As String, mode As String, value As String)
public: void AttributeDecl(System::String ^ eName, System::String ^ aName, System::String ^ type, System::String ^ mode, System::String ^ value);
public void AttributeDecl (string? eName, string? aName, string? type, string? mode, string? value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AttributeDecl(string eName, string aName, string type, string mode, string value) cil managed
abstract member AttributeDecl : string * string * string * string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the associated element.
A string representing the attribute type.
A string representing the attribute defaulting mode ("#IMPLIED", "#REQUIRED", or "#FIXED") or null if none of these applies.
A string representing the attribute's default value, or null if there is none.

remarks.para: Report an attribute type declaration.

Only the effective (first) declaration for an attribute will be reported. The type will be one of the strings "CDATA", "ID", "IDREF", "IDREFS", "NMTOKEN", "NMTOKENS", "ENTITY", "ENTITIES", a parenthesized token group with the separator "|" and all whitespace removed, or the word "NOTATION" followed by a space followed by a parenthesized token group with all whitespace removed.
The value will be the value as reported to applications, appropriately normalized and with entity and character references expanded.

format.a: Java documentation for org.xml.sax.ext.DeclHandler.attributeDecl(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: The application may raise an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub ElementDecl (name As String, model As String)
public: void ElementDecl(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ model);
public void ElementDecl (string? name, string? model);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ElementDecl(string name, string model) cil managed
abstract member ElementDecl : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The content model as a normalized string.

remarks.para: Report an element type declaration.

The content model will consist of the string "EMPTY", the string "ANY", or a parenthesised group, optionally followed by an occurrence indicator. The model will be normalized so that all parameter entities are fully resolved and all whitespace is removed,and will include the enclosing parentheses. Other normalization (such as removing redundant parentheses or simplifying occurrence indicators) is at the discretion of the parser.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: The application may raise an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub ExternalEntityDecl (name As String, publicId As String, systemId As String)
public: void ExternalEntityDecl(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ publicId, System::String ^ systemId);
public void ExternalEntityDecl (string? name, string? publicId, string? systemId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExternalEntityDecl(string name, string publicId, string systemId) cil managed
abstract member ExternalEntityDecl : string * string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the entity. If it is a parameter entity, the name will begin with '%'.
The entity's public identifier, or null if none was given.
Docs.summary: Report a parsed external entity declaration.

remarks.para: Report a parsed external entity declaration.
Only the effective (first) declaration for each entity will be reported.
If the system identifier is a URL, the parser must resolve it fully before passing it to the application.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: The application may raise an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub InternalEntityDecl (name As String, value As String)
public: void InternalEntityDecl(System::String ^ name, System::String ^ value);
public void InternalEntityDecl (string? name, string? value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InternalEntityDecl(string name, string value) cil managed
abstract member InternalEntityDecl : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the entity. If it is a parameter entity, the name will begin with '%'.
The replacement text of the entity.

remarks.para: Report an internal entity declaration.
Only the effective (first) declaration for each entity will be reported. All parameter entities in the value will be expanded, but general entities will not.
